<MembersIndex>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw_ostream</a></>}>
This class implements an extremely fast bulk output stream that can <em>only</em> output to a stream. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-pwrite-stream">raw_pwrite_stream</a></>}>

</MembersIndexItem>

<Link id="l00064" /><CodeLine lineNumber="64"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The buffer is handled in such a way that the buffer is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00065" /><CodeLine lineNumber="65"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// uninitialized, unbuffered, or out of space when OutBufCur &gt;=</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00066" /><CodeLine lineNumber="66"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// OutBufEnd. Thus a single comparison suffices to determine if we</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00067" /><CodeLine lineNumber="67"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// need to take the slow path to write a single character.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="68"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00069" /><CodeLine lineNumber="69"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The buffer is in one of three states:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00070" /><CodeLine lineNumber="70"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  1 Unbuffered (BufferMode == Unbuffered)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00071" /><CodeLine lineNumber="71"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  1 Uninitialized (BufferMode != Unbuffered &amp;&amp; OutBufStart == 0).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00072" /><CodeLine lineNumber="72"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///  2 Buffered (BufferMode != Unbuffered &amp;&amp; OutBufStart != 0 &amp;&amp;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00073" /><CodeLine lineNumber="73"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///               OutBufEnd - OutBufStart &gt;= 1).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00074" /><CodeLine lineNumber="74"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00075" /><CodeLine lineNumber="75"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If buffered, then the raw&#95;ostream owns the buffer if (BufferMode ==</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00076" /><CodeLine lineNumber="76"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// InternalBuffer); otherwise the buffer has been set via SetBuffer and is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00077" /><CodeLine lineNumber="77"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// managed by the subclass.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00078" /><CodeLine lineNumber="78"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00079" /><CodeLine lineNumber="79"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If a subclass installs an external buffer using SetBuffer then it can wait</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00080" /><CodeLine lineNumber="80"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// for a \\see write&#95;impl() call to handle the data which has been put into</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// tell - Return the current offset with the file.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="155"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// If possible, pre-allocate \\p ExtraSize bytes for stream data.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="156"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// i.e. it extends internal buffers to keep additional ExtraSize bytes.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="157"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// So that the stream could keep at least tell() + ExtraSize bytes</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="158"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// without re-allocations. reserveExtraSpace() does not change</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// the size/data of the stream.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#if defined(&#95;&#95;cpp&#95;char8&#95;t)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// When using &#96;char8&#95;t &#42;&#96; integers or pointers are written to the ostream</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instead of UTF-8 code as one might expect. This might lead to unexpected</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// behavior, especially as &#96;u8&quot;&quot;&#96; literals are of type &#96;char8&#95;t&#42;&#96; instead of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// type &#96;char&#95;t&#42;&#96; from C++20 onwards. Thus we disallow using them with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// raw&#95;ostreams.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If you have u8&quot;&quot; literals to stream, you can rewrite them as ordinary</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// literals with escape sequences</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// e.g.  replace &#96;u8&quot;\\u00a0&quot;&#96; by &#96;&quot;\\xc2\\xa0&quot;&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or use &#96;reinterpret&#95;cast&#96;:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// e.g. replace &#96;u8&quot;\\u00a0&quot;&#96; by &#96;reinterpret&#95;cast&lt;const char &#42;&gt;(u8&quot;\\u00a0&quot;)&#96;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#a51b9992ae460e4e0fb0fa7ce054494e8">operator&lt;&lt;</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char8&#95;t</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Str) = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">delete</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#ac4379610669a40c09242de6f02bf715b"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#a0f4b64a0f7aec0a02e7f2ff5a6552723">raw&#95;ostream</a> &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-ostream/#ac4379610669a40c09242de6f02bf715b">operator&lt;&lt;</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">char</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Str) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Inline fast path, particularly for constant strings where a sufficiently</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// smart compiler will simplify strlen.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="328"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// forward.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00329" /><CodeLine lineNumber="329"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @param Color ANSI color to use, the special SAVEDCOLOR can be used to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00550" /><CodeLine lineNumber="550"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// stream. Specifying a nullptr unties the stream. This is intended for to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00551" /><CodeLine lineNumber="551"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// tie errs() to outs(), so that outs() is flushed whenever something is</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00559" /><CodeLine lineNumber="559"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// output error has been encountered.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00564" /><CodeLine lineNumber="564"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Set the flag read by has&#95;error() to false. If the error flag is set at the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00565" /><CodeLine lineNumber="565"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// time when this raw&#95;ostream&#39;s destructor is called, report&#95;fatal&#95;error is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00566" /><CodeLine lineNumber="566"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// called to report the error. Use clear&#95;error() after handling the error to</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00568" /><CodeLine lineNumber="568"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00569" /><CodeLine lineNumber="569"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   &quot;Errors should never pass silently.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00570" /><CodeLine lineNumber="570"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///    Unless explicitly silenced.&quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00571" /><CodeLine lineNumber="571"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///      - from The Zen of Python, by Tim Peters</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00572" /><CodeLine lineNumber="572"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00573" /><CodeLine lineNumber="573" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-ostream/#a7b4fefe70f73556669fd513ed9d0fae4"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-ostream/#a7b4fefe70f73556669fd513ed9d0fae4">clear&#95;error</a>() &#123; EC = std::error&#95;code(); &#125;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00575" /><CodeLine lineNumber="575"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Locks the underlying file.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00576" /><CodeLine lineNumber="576"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00577" /><CodeLine lineNumber="577"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// @returns RAII object that releases the lock upon leaving the scope, if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00578" /><CodeLine lineNumber="578"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          locking was successful. Otherwise returns corresponding</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00579" /><CodeLine lineNumber="579"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///          error code.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00580" /><CodeLine lineNumber="580"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00581" /><CodeLine lineNumber="581"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// The function blocks the current thread until the lock become available or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00582" /><CodeLine lineNumber="582"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// error occurs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00583" /><CodeLine lineNumber="583"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00584" /><CodeLine lineNumber="584"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Possible use of this function may be as follows:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00585" /><CodeLine lineNumber="585"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00586" /><CodeLine lineNumber="586"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   @code&#123;.cpp&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00587" /><CodeLine lineNumber="587"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   if (auto L = stream.lock()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     // ... do action that require file to be locked.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   &#125; else &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     handleAllErrors(std::move(L.takeError()), &#91;&amp;&#93;(ErrorInfoBase &amp;EIB) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///       // ... handle lock error.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///     &#125;);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00593" /><CodeLine lineNumber="593"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00594" /><CodeLine lineNumber="594"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///   @endcode</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00595" /><CodeLine lineNumber="595"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#91;&#91;nodiscard&#93;&#93; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/expected">Expected&lt;sys::fs::FileLocker&gt;</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-fd-ostream/#a5a33d325e887c5cfa94e8abac79145b3">lock</a>();</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00596" /><CodeLine lineNumber="596"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00686" /><CodeLine lineNumber="686"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// A raw&#95;ostream that writes to an SmallVector or SmallString.  This is a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00687" /><CodeLine lineNumber="687"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// simple adaptor class. This class does not encounter output errors.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00688" /><CodeLine lineNumber="688"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// raw&#95;svector&#95;ostream operates without a buffer, delegating all memory</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00689" /><CodeLine lineNumber="689"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// management to the SmallString. Thus the SmallString is always up-to-date,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00690" /><CodeLine lineNumber="690"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// may be used directly and there is no need to call flush().</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00691" /><CodeLine lineNumber="691" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-svector-ostream"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-svector-ostream/#ac5de2c3f4305e6a5f5a6076e5f60c7d7">raw&#95;svector&#95;ostream</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/raw-pwrite-stream/#a6114ce21446653490e1d609d876b42eb">raw&#95;pwrite&#95;stream</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00692" /><CodeLine lineNumber="692"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/smallvectorimpl">SmallVectorImpl&lt;char&gt;</a> &amp;OS;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00771" /><CodeLine lineNumber="771"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00772" /><CodeLine lineNumber="772"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Helper struct to add indentation to raw&#95;ostream. Instead of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00773" /><CodeLine lineNumber="773"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// OS.indent(6) &lt;&lt; &quot;more stuff&quot;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00774" /><CodeLine lineNumber="774"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// you can use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00775" /><CodeLine lineNumber="775"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// OS &lt;&lt; indent(6) &lt;&lt; &quot;more stuff&quot;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00776" /><CodeLine lineNumber="776"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which has better ergonomics (and clang-formats better as well).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00777" /><CodeLine lineNumber="777"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00778" /><CodeLine lineNumber="778"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If indentation is always in increments of a fixed value, you can use Scale</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00779" /><CodeLine lineNumber="779"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to set that value once. So indent(1, 2) will add 2 spaces and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00780" /><CodeLine lineNumber="780"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// indent(1,2) + 1 will add 4 spaces.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00781" /><CodeLine lineNumber="781" lineLink="/docs/api/structs/llvm/indent"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">struct </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/indent/#a7abaab1529c2b7718889fd4400a7f653">indent</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00782" /><CodeLine lineNumber="782"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Indentation is represented as &#96;NumIndents&#96; steps of size &#96;Scale&#96; each.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00832" /><CodeLine lineNumber="832"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This helper creates an output stream and then passes it to \\p Write.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00833" /><CodeLine lineNumber="833"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// The stream created is based on the specified \\p OutputFileName:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00834" /><CodeLine lineNumber="834"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// llvm::outs for &quot;-&quot;, raw&#95;null&#95;ostream for &quot;/dev/null&quot;, and raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00835" /><CodeLine lineNumber="835"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// for other names. For raw&#95;fd&#95;ostream instances, the stream writes to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00836" /><CodeLine lineNumber="836"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a temporary file. The final output file is atomically replaced with the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00837" /><CodeLine lineNumber="837"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// temporary file after the \\p Write function is finished.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00838" /><CodeLine lineNumber="838"><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a80a1017cd2662da510365c7ee41a782a">writeToOutput</a>(StringRef OutputFileName,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00839" /><CodeLine lineNumber="839"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    std::function&lt;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ac226f3d2b9ca090171a8e0a8cb92c343a902b0d55fddef6f8d651fe1035b7d4bd">Error</a>(raw&#95;ostream &amp;)&gt; <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a171c000a87a56f9b4c9b4e3f43c5facfa738b693496ce85aba70051f0aa8722bd">Write</a>);</span></CodeLine>
